title: Jane The Virgin’s Gina Rodriguez apologises for using n-word in deleted video
text:
Gina Rodriguez has come under fire for her Instagram video (Picture: Rex, Instagram, Gina Rodriguez)

Gina Rodriguez has apologised for using the n-word in a now deleted video on Instagram.

The Jane The Virgin actress posted a now-deleted clip on her Instagram story, where she rapped along to Ready Or Not by The Fugees while getting her hair and make-up done.

At the very end of the video – shared with her 4.4million followers – the 35-year-old made the slur, before laughing at someone off screen.

She has since deleted the post, and shared another video, apologising for her actions.

‘Hey, what’s up everybody — I just wanted to reach out and apologise,’ she said. ‘I am sorry. I am sorry if I offended anyone by singing along to The Fugees, to a song I love, that I grew up on.

‘I love Lauryn Hill and I really am sorry if I offended you.’

Unimpressed fans flocked to Twitter to call the actress out over the video, with her name trending worldwide within minutes.

Gina was trending worldwide on Twitter after the video (Picture: Getty)

‘The fact that she thought this was fine and posted it is LAUGHABLE,’ one fumed.

‘I don’t get it. I really don’t. She claims to be so woke and caring about people’s struggles yet doesn’t even pretend to care about what black people tell her,’ another said.

‘I wonder if she’s even going to acknowledge this.’

‘All she had to do was NOT say that part,’ an unimpressed fan suggested. ‘She had the whole verse to rap, with so many other words. All she had to do…….’

A follower asked: ‘Why would Gina Rodriguez even post that???’

This isn’t the first time Gina has been accused of being ‘anti-black’, after she sparked outrage with her comments on women’s pay at the end of last year.

During a roundtable interview last year – alongside Gabrielle Union, Ellen Pompeo and Emma Roberts, the Netflix star was met with fury when she claimed black women get paid more than their Latina and Asian counterparts.

However, many accused her of being inaccurate and ‘anti-black’, stating Sofia Vergara is the highest paid actress according to Forbes.

She later broke down when addressing the wave of intense backlash she faced, revealing: ‘The backlash was devastating, to say the least.

‘The black community was the only community I looked towards growing up. We didn’t have many Latino shows and the black community made me feel like I was seen. So to get anti-black is saying I’m anti-family.

‘If anything, the black community is my community,’ she continued on Sway’s Universe. ‘As Latinos, we have black Latinos; that is what we are. I am not, so I think when I speak about Latino advocacy, people believe I mean only my skin colour, little do they know I’m very aware of what my culture is, and the opportunities I create, and who I put in those spaces are both the Latino and the black community.

‘When that happened, that was really f**king hard. Because what do you say? Sorry for cheating when you didn’t cheat?’

Metro.co.uk has contacted Gina’s reps for a comment.
